heading: dow newbie sbc's big profits
subheading: a day after it's vaulted into the lofty heights of the dow jones industrial average, the top us local telephone company posts better-than-expected earnings.
author: reuters
text: new york -- sbc communications inc., the no. 1 us local telephone company, said on wednesday its third-quarter profits, excluding one-time items, rose a better-than-expected 22.5 percent amid strong growth in data, wireless, and international services. sbc, which on tuesday was named to the dow jones industrial average, said its third-quarter profits were $1.3 billion or 64 cents a share, compared with $1.0 billion or 53 cents a share a year ago.the year-ago results exclude a $219 million gain, primarily from the sale of some south african investments.san antonio, texas-based sbc's results beat wall street's earnings expectations of 61 cents a share, according to research firm first call/thomson financial.sbc's operating revenues rose 7.6 percent to $7.8 billion from $7.2 billion a year ago. the results reflect sbc as a stand-alone company before its $61 billion acquisition of sister baby bell ameritech corp on 8 october.including the ameritech deal, sbc's pro forma net income fell 41 percent to $1.1 billion or 33 cents a share, from $1.9 billion or 56 cents a share a year ago. pro forma operating revenues rose 8 percent to $12.5 billion from $11.6 billion a year ago.the current pro forma results include several one-time merger-related items, such as charges related to goodwill for ameritech's security business and charges from synchronizing accounting estimation techniques. the year-ago results include the gain from the sale of the south african investment.sbc's said its pro forma data services revenues increased 43.4 percent to $1.5 billion, fueled by continued demand for high-capacity, high-speed services.sbc, like other local phone companies, has been investing heavily in new data services. sbc earlier this month announced a $6 billion project to upgrade its local phone network to provide high-speed internet access.wireless subscriber revenues increased 25 percent, driven by the strength of existing operations and by the acquisition of cellular communications of puerto rico, which added 375,000 subscribers. sbc's domestic wireless customer base totalled 10.3 million, an increase of 24.7 percent.sales of calling features such as caller id or call waiting increased 12.4 percent to $861 million. features per access line increased 18 percent to 1.3 services.sbc said its quarterly results were also buoyed by its strong international performance. sbc now has investments in 22 countries outside the united states.copyright* 1999 reuters limited.*
